alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 9:38AM MDT until June 09 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Valley. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 AM MDT, Areal flooding continues from recent excessive rainfall. The Beaver Creek at Hinsdale is at 16.8 feet as of 8am Sunday which is in moderate flood stage and is forecast to fall below flood stage by Tuesday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hinsdale, Tampico, Vandalia and The Bentonite Plant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
